#summary Philip's Excellent Guide to Updating Your Sensors in Five Minutes or Less

Here's the Cliff's Notes to updating your sensors when a new distribution is released. 

== 1. Download Sensors Distribution == 

  * Go to the V8 home page: [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat/]

  * Click on the first "Featured Download", such as "hackystat-8.1.218-sensors-bin.zip"

  * Unzip into a directory like "public_hackystat/".

== 2. Update Ant Sensors ==

  * Edit your ANT_ARGS environment variable to refer the latest release, such as:
{{{
-lib C:\public_hackystat\hackystat-8.1.218-sensors-bin\hackystat-sensor-ant\antsensors.jar -listener org.hackystat.sensor.ant.antbuild.BuildSensorAntListener
}}}

  * Edit your HACKYSTAT_ANTSENSORS_HOME to refer to the latest release, such as:
{{{
C:\public_hackystat\hackystat-8.1.218-sensors-bin\hackystat-sensor-ant
}}}

  * Edit your HACKYSTAT_XMLDATA_HOME to refer to the latest release, such as:
{{{
C:\public_hackystat\hackystat-8.1.218-sensors-bin\hackystat-sensor-xmldata
}}}

  * On Windows, close all your console windows and restart them to make these environment variable changes take effect.  On Unix, 'source ~/.profile' or analogous.

== 4. Update Eclipse ==

  * Close Eclipse.

  * Copy the jar file from the new distribution's hackystat-sensor-eclipse directory to your Eclipse plugins directory.  The jar file is named something like: org.hackystat.sensor.eclipse_8.0.v20080218.jar. 

== 5. Update Emacs ==

  * Close Emacs.

  * Edit your .emacs to refer to the latest release, such as:
{{{{
(defvar hackystat*user-home "C:\\Documents and Settings\\johnson\\")
(defvar system-distribution "C:\\public_hackystat\\hackystat-8.1.218-sensors-bin\\")
(defvar hackystat*sensorshell*file-path (concat system-distribution "hackystat-sensor-shell/"))
(load-file (concat system-distribution "hackystat-sensor-emacs/sensor-package.el"))
}}}


  * Restart Emacs.

== 6. Verify ==

  * Use your tools, make sure that data is being sent.
